dialogue_metadata.inferred_vibe: Informational and enthusiastic discussion about business news.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Alright, so Netflix, right? They're, uh, about to drop their earnings report and everyone's really watching this one. They're back near peak levels after a little dip.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Alright, so Netflix, right? They're, uh, about to drop their earnings report and everyone's really watching this one. They're back near peak levels after a little dip.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: With the firm set to report earnings Tuesday after the market close, here are five numbers that show just how much the firm has dominated entertainment in the pandemic age...shares of the Los Gatos, California-based firm are once again nearing peak levels.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, it's wild. I mean, they took a small hit in September, but they are *right* back up there. And you look at some of these numbers, it's just mind-boggling how much they've dominated.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, it's wild. I mean, they took a small hit in September, but they are right back up there. And you look at some of these numbers, it's just mind-boggling how much they've dominated.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Though they took a small hit amid the broader market's September correctionafter an all-time Netflix high in late Augustshares of the Los Gatos, California-based firm are once again nearing peak levels.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, totally. The market cap alone, Host_B. We're talking $235 billion. That's, like, an almost $75 billion jump *just* this year. They're bigger than Disney, Comcast, AT&T...
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, totally. The market cap alone, Host_B. We're talking two hundred thirty five billion dollars. That's, like, an almost seventy five billion jump just this year. They're bigger than Disney, Comcast, A T and T.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: It's up nearly $100 billion in 2020 alone, making the 23-year-old streaming giant one of the 20 largest companies on the S&P 500 by market capahead of even media mainstays like Walt Disney, Comcast and AT&T.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [interrupts] Which is, you know, incredible when you think about it. For a 23-year-old company. And their shares? Up over 40% since January! The S&P 500 is only up like 4.5% in comparison.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which is, you know, incredible when you think about it. For a twenty three-year-old company. And their shares? Up over forty percent since January! The S and P five hundred is only up like four point five percent in comparison.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Netflix shares have soared more than 60% since the beginning of the year. To compare, the S&P 500 is up just 6.5% in 2020.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right? And Reed Hastings, the co-founder, he's, uh, he's done pretty well for himself during the pandemic. Like, over $3 billion... now worth about $4.8 billion. Crazy.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right? And Reed Hastings, the co-founder, he's, uh, he's done pretty well for himself during the pandemic. Like, over three billion dollars... now worth about four point eight billion dollars. Crazy.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The firm's billionaire cofounder and CEO, Reed Hastings, has gotten nearly $2 billion during the pandemic. The 60-year-old, who launched Netflix as a DVD subscription service in 1997 and owns roughly 1% of its shares, is now worth about $5.4 billion.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely insane. But the real story, I think, is the subscribers. Analysts are expecting them to hit 195 million paid subs. That's, like, another 2.5 million just this quarter.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely insane. But the real story, I think, is the subscribers. Analysts are expecting them to hit one hundred ninety five million paid subs. That's, like, another two point five million just this quarter.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: 195 Million That's the number of paid subscribers analysts expect Netflix will report on Tuesday, up 2.5 million quarter to quarter and in line with the firm's latest guidance.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and they added *twenty-eight million* in the first half of the year! I mean, obviously, people being stuck at home, you know, government-mandated quarantines, they just flocked to streaming.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and they added twenty-eight million in the first half of the year! I mean, obviously, people being stuck at home, you know, government-mandated quarantines, they just flocked to streaming.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Netflix said in July that it added 26 million subscribers during the first half of the year (10 million in the first quarter and nearly 16 million in the second)

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. Turning away from movie theaters, live shows... it was the only game in town for a lot of people. And some analysts are even saying that number could be conservative, especially with international growth.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. Turning away from movie theaters, live shows... it was the only game in town for a lot of people. And some analysts are even saying that number could be conservative, especially with international growth.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: That increase could even prove conservative, noted investment research firm CFRA on Monday, reiterating its buy rating on Netflix shares and adding that the firm could be bolstered by an increase in subscribers from international markets.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, what about the money coming in? The revenue?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, what about the money coming in? The revenue?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: They're looking at nearly $5.8 billion in third-quarter revenues, which is up over 15% from last year. Though, um, earnings per share might be down a bit because of heightened costs.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: They're looking at nearly five point eight billion dollars in third-quarter revenues, which is up over fifteen percent from last year. Though, um, earnings per share might be down a bit because of heightened costs.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Analysts are expecting Netflix will pull nearly $6.4 billion in third-quarter revenues, up more than 20% from the same period last year.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: [interrupts] Oh, right, the costs. Like, production and all that.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, right, the costs. Like, production and all that.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly! But still, the overall picture... And Bank of America, they're pretty bullish, right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly! But still, the overall picture... And Bank of America, they're pretty bullish, right?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, super bullish. They just issued a $670 price target for Netflix. That's, like, up almost 17% from their previous target of $575.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, super bullish. They just issued a six hundred seventy dollar price target for Netflix. That's, like, up almost seventeen percent from their previous target of five hundred seventy five dollars.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: $670 That's the price target Bank of America issued on Friday for Netflix, up nearly 17% from a prior target of $575 and representing the highest Netflix price target on Wall Street.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: That's the highest on Wall Street, isn't it?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's the highest on Wall Street, isn't it?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...and representing the highest Netflix price target on Wall Street.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: It is! And they see this acceleration in subscriber growth from the first half of the year as a permanent benefit. So, uh, Netflix isn't going anywhere anytime soon, it seems.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It is! And they see this acceleration in subscriber growth from the first half of the year as a permanent benefit. So, uh, Netflix isn't going anywhere anytime soon, it seems.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Bank of America said it continues to see the acceleration in Netflix subscriber growth during the first half of the year as a permanent benefit.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, it really sounds like they've just completely dominated the entertainment landscape during this whole pandemic era. Pretty impressive.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, it really sounds like they've just completely dominated the entertainment landscape during this whole pandemic era. Pretty impressive.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...here are five numbers that show just how much the firm has dominated entertainment in the pandemic age.
